title: DelgonAgain
author: DelgonAgain
content: Hello,I got a tip from someone on the forum that this might be the place to write about it.Some time ago my account was banned.I think my only (first post, I think) was when I posted about the new cpuminer fork with improvements to GhostRider algorightm (https://github.com/WyvernTKC/cpuminer-gr-avx2)It might be that the confusion about potential plagiarism or posting about not my repo was from those points:1. Repo is maintained by Dev 1 (WyvernTKC / Ausminer).2. 1st release was pushed to the git fully by him, so there were no real mentions in the code about me, we started working from that point on, I have some DMs or you could even ask him directly if needed. (point 2 should prove it tho)3. Most of the later changes and releases of the miner were done by me, but the nick of GitHub also does not match my nick here Delgon vs (https://github.com/michal-zurkowski). Some metadata from here on my old account should match the ones on GitHub, I can also prove it some other way if needed.4. Now looking at release/commits, you can see my contribution but it might have been looking like I did not participate in the project then due to no pushes from me (https://github.com/WyvernTKC/cpuminer-gr-avx2/releases https://github.com/WyvernTKC/cpuminer-gr-avx2/commits/main)I tried to write a mail before like it was mentioned in the banner when I logged back in but no one ever responded to them.If possible I would appreciate looking into it and hopefully reversing the ban from that time, I think it was unjustified but maybe I broke some rule that I missed that time.My previous user id is here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3282724Delgon

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Here's the archived version of the post for anyone who wants to check it out; https://loyce.club/archive/posts/5674/56744281.htmlWaiting for an email response or sending a follow up mail might be the best way to go. There you could provide more information on your moniker on git and prove that it's same person on this account.

comments.author: examplens
comments.created_time: November 22, 2022, 08:45:03 PMLast edit: November 22, 2022, 09:27:55 PM by examplens
comments.body: looking at the archive, I see that you posted some download links in your post. were they all virus free? It can be a reason for a ban if someone finds malicious software in links recommended by you.Also, right after the subject, you posted donation addresses. of course it's not forbidden, but you sounded like you were begging, and I believe that this only made it easier for the admin to ban you.otherwise, it was a new account with only one post, so I don't even see a serious reason why the moderators would check your case again. However, you did not contribute to this forum.edit: tested your windows download link, and here is a result from Virustotalhttps://www.virustotal.com/gui/url/aeb59ce90026f7a1b6911eea3a985ddf098e0059218c77176711c80407bfa31b?nocache=1

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: DelgonAgain on November 22, 2022, 07:19:56 PMI tried to write a mail before like it was mentioned in the banner when I logged back in but no one ever responded to them.If possible I would appreciate looking into it and hopefully reversing the ban from that time, I think it was unjustified but maybe I broke some rule that I missed that time.It's possible your ban was a mistake, someone reported it after checking files you posted, or bot banned you, but in future try not to post any download links from mega and other similar websites, github link is enough.I would also suggest before posting download link to check if antivirus programs detects false positive in your code, that could be one of the reasons you got banned.Moderators should reply here soon and explain what happened, so please be patient.

comments.author: DelgonAgain
comments.body: Quote from: examplens on November 22, 2022, 08:45:03 PMlooking at the archive, I see that you posted some download links in your post. were they all virus free? It can be a reason for a ban if someone finds malicious software in links recommended by you.Also, right after the subject, you posted donation addresses. of course it's not forbidden, but you sounded like you were begging, and I believe that this only made it easier for the admin to ban you.otherwise, it was a new account with only one post, so I don't even see a serious reason why the moderators would check your case again. However, you did not contribute to this forum.At that point, no AV or Windows Defender reported anything about them. The releases started getting flagged by AV after the first RTM boom when more users started using it.Ye, Mega links might not have been the best idea looking at it right now but never thought it would lead to the ban :/We discussed it with Ausminer and decided to only put my address in the forum as only his address was set as dev fee in the miner back then.Yes, account was new as I kinda created it for that purpose. Did not expect that I would need a lot of time or posts on the forum to move forward with posting thisQuote from: Upgrade00 on November 22, 2022, 08:31:11 PMHere's the archived version of the post for anyone who wants to check it out; https://loyce.club/archive/posts/5674/56744281.htmlWaiting for an email response or sending a follow up mail might be the best way to go. There you could provide more information on your moniker on git and prove that it's same person on this account.I wrote an email but got no response whatsoever, hence my try here. I'm more than willing to prove ownership of the GitHub account or other stuff if needed in any way that is acceptable by them

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.created_time: November 22, 2022, 09:45:22 PMLast edit: November 22, 2022, 10:04:07 PM by Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Why did you use Mega.nz links, for starters?Most members who spread malware here use Mega.nz, and they get flagged and banned as soon as possibleAlso, I took time to download the Windows file and 39 AV engines flagged as malicious. Now, I know there are some false positives and false negatives when it comes to virus total, but 39/64 AV engines? That's quite a number.https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/d3526db408011a96112ab5794ecf16254ba8cf9de37c5ca484837a3cec3f8911?nocache=1

comments.author: DelgonAgain
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on November 22, 2022, 09:45:22 PMWhy did you use Mega.nz links, for starters?Most members who spread malware here use Mega.nz, and they get flagged and banned as soon as possibleI agree now that I should have just stuck with pushing files to GitHub release, there is nothing I can do about it now tho :/Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on November 22, 2022, 09:45:22 PMAlso, I took time to download the Windows file and 39 AV engines flagged as malicious. Now, I know there are some false positives and false negatives when it comes to virus total, but 39/64 AV engines? That's quite a number.https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/d3526db408011a96112ab5794ecf16254ba8cf9de37c5ca484837a3cec3f8911?nocache=1As you can see, most are classified as "Miner" or related. Most are also heuristics looking for mining code, stratum etc.It has even fewer hits than cpuminer-opt which was used as a base for it (forked).cpuminer-opt 45/67 https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/5b18ce4d1b344fdd03b46537a29e59569588322ad13faf19cfa97264cc60cb3eSRBMiner 24/67 (https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/08aa625d9bcfb7627ff67a8b3a8dd0dec7d66b2aaab1dca655972a6251c29418)XMRIG:Â  51/67 (https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/e12abacd392970ecd60e3ef32eaad5d17377b29be257ef2a2a1bd4cd2eda6176)

comments.author: Sandra_hakeem
comments.body: I think it's one of the rules of posting here; most especially, newbies like you that just got registered and haven't been known to which perspective the essence of your registration lies.Why should you bother about an account that hasn't made any name yet? Maybe that's your preferred moniker? Okay I'd reconsider things to your favor but, I'm afraid, it's unnecessary.I remember a time I tried to post a reference Link, in a bid to site my post but, the link was rejected simultaneously, every single time I tried. I haven't really had time to vet through those links but from BA's points, they smell fishy and anyone could be banned for the same malicious act.... anyone.Sandra ðŸ’‡

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: The truth is you have less chance to get reversal on your ban, since its almost clear that the link you posted has malicious content which will be never encouraged here as far as I know. If you still need the exact answer for the ban then mod who handled the report can only answer it.Already lot of members suggested the reason for ban can also be added in the banner but its still not considered by admin for some reason but if that gets implemented then surely meta board can avoid lot of threads asking about the reason for ban.

comments.author: DelgonAgain
comments.body: Quote from: Findingnemo on November 23, 2022, 04:21:39 PMThe truth is you have less chance to get reversal on your ban, since its almost clear that the link you posted has malicious content which will be never encouraged here as far as I know. If you still need the exact answer for the ban then mod who handled the report can only answer it.Already lot of members suggested the reason for ban can also be added in the banner but its still not considered by admin for some reason but if that gets implemented then surely meta board can avoid lot of threads asking about the reason for ban.That would make pretty much any miner here impossible to be posted. Like I said, even cpuminer from jdd has more flags than the fork we put, and xmrig has many more, and pretty much any miner that is on the forum will get flagged similarly like srbminer, and gpu miners which all are ok in this case even if they are flagged as malicious. If there is any normal mining software that has 0 flags, please let me know.To get it past AV you would need to have the binaries signed which as we can see, is not the case with most (pretty much all) mining software.

comments.author: krishnaverma
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on November 22, 2022, 08:52:03 PMQuote from: DelgonAgain on November 22, 2022, 07:19:56 PMI tried to write a mail before like it was mentioned in the banner when I logged back in but no one ever responded to them.If possible I would appreciate looking into it and hopefully reversing the ban from that time, I think it was unjustified but maybe I broke some rule that I missed that time.It's possible your ban was a mistake,No, it is not. Please read the reply above yours. He posted a download link with virus.

comments.author: CryptoPanda
comments.body: The profile of the banned account shows there have been zero posts though it was created in 2021 so it could be you only made one post which is the one you got banned for or that the moderators deleted all your posts if they did then it must have been something other than plagiarism you did because I still see plagiarized content still being commented on even though the OP has been reported and banned. It would seem you really like the username because you made an appeal for an account with no rank.

comments.author: DelgonAgain
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoPanda on November 24, 2022, 10:58:58 AM[...] It would seem you really like the username because you made an appeal for an account with no rank. If it was banned, then making another one to just post normally would classify as ban evasion which I personally do not like, hence the appeal, to clear things up and see what happens.Quote from: krishnaverma on November 24, 2022, 08:07:32 AMQuote from: dkbit98 on November 22, 2022, 08:52:03 PMIt's possible your ban was a mistake,No, it is not. Please read the reply above yours. He posted a download link with virus. As I said. It would be almost impossible to expect a miner to not be heuristically detected by AV as a miner. cpuminer-opt and xmrig has many more warnings and hits, should they also be banned from here along with pretty much 99% of other mining software?I would expect any cpuminer fork to have similar (we had fewer, and the latest version has even fewer hits) hits than cpuminer itself. Same with xmrig.Try most of the used GPU or CPU miners on Total Virus and you will see similar results, which you would classify as malicious and with a high potential for a ban.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: DelgonAgain on November 25, 2022, 05:19:11 AMQuote from: CryptoPanda on November 24, 2022, 10:58:58 AM[...] It would seem you really like the username because you made an appeal for an account with no rank. If it was banned, then making another one to just post normally would classify as ban evasion which I personally do not like, hence the appeal, to clear things up and see what happens.Hopefully, one of the global moderators will see this and give a go or no-go on whether you can continue posting with this account or unban your old "Delgon" account.Quote from: DelgonAgain on November 25, 2022, 05:19:11 AMAs I said. It would be almost impossible to expect a miner to not be heuristically detected by AV as a miner. cpuminer-opt and xmrig has many more warnings and hits, should they also be banned from here along with pretty much 99% of other mining software?I would expect any cpuminer fork to have similar (we had fewer, and the latest version has even fewer hits) hits than cpuminer itself. Same with xmrig.Try most of the used GPU or CPU miners on Total Virus and you will see similar results, which you would classify as malicious and with a high potential for a ban.I think that the main problem with your old topic was that the link to the GitHub repository was not properly referenced, and you even mentioned that you are not the developer of the code in the repository. Also, the links to binaries in your post leads to a third-party cloud storage (mega.cz), which is often used by bad actors to spread malware online.
